text: Lieutenant Commander John Rich Craig (13 September 1906 - 22 March 1943) was an officer in the United States Navy. ==Biography== Born in Jacksonville, Florida, Craig graduated from the United States Naval Academy in 1930 and received flight training the following year. During 1935 and 1936 he underwent submarine training. Prior to the outbreak of World War II, he commanded . He took command of 16 September 1942. During the next 6 months he led the submarine on high risk attacks against Japanese shipping. She sank two enemy transports and a cargo ship and damaged three enemy destroyers. While on her sixth war patrol, Grampus was lost in the Southwest Pacific with all hands 22 March 1943. Lt. Comdr. Craig was awarded the Navy Cross posthumously for his extraordinary heroism. was named for him. ==Family== With Lillian Hyde, a schoolteacher, he had a daughter, Lillian Hyde "Kitten" Craig, later known as the writer, Kit Reed. Through Reed, he is a grandfather of the writer, Kate Maruyama.Richard Sandomir, "Kit Reed, 85, Novelist Who Used Dark Humor", The New York Times, October 1, 2017, p.25. ==Citations== Category:United States Navy officers Category:1906 births Category:1943 deaths Category:Recipients of the Navy Cross (United States) Category:American naval personnel killed in World War II Category:United States submarine commanders
